e8a1703f-1966-4bfb-8b90-4dd4f1be60e8.description: The course objective is to produce more effective fire department structural firefighting incident operations. Blue Card also increases firefighter safety and survival.
e8a1703f-1966-4bfb-8b90-4dd4f1be60e8.name: Blue Card Incident Commander (IC) Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and performance rubrics (checklists) with a minimum passing score of 70 percent for online testing and 100 percent for hands-on simulations evaluations.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lecture, and classroom exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 5 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

866d5c05-c375-4b9a-a09f-22a4aae47df6.description: The course objective is for the students to become the Blue Card Trainer for their fire department. Blue Card Trainers deliver the 3-day Blue Card IC cert lab to their IC students.
866d5c05-c375-4b9a-a09f-22a4aae47df6.name: Blue Card Train-the-Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include performance rubrics (checklists) with a minimum passing score of 100 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lecture, and classroom exercises. The general course topics include review of the functions of command; instruction and simulations for the five major building types; managing firefighter mayday operations; and overview of the Blue Card system - LMS, RMS, managing ongoing continuing education and recertification.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

169da6ae-2ff7-459b-8c23-06074e7f6842.description: The course objective is to produce safer and more effective incident operations that involve hazardous materials.
169da6ae-2ff7-459b-8c23-06074e7f6842.name: Blue Card HazMat

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and performance rubrics (checklists) with a minimum passing score of 70 percent for online testing and 100 percent for hands-on simulations evaluations.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, discussion, computer-based training, lecture, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include HAZMAT - carbon monoxide module; HAZMAT - command module; HAZMAT - compressed inert gas; HAZMAT - natural gas; and HAZMAT - weapons of mass destruction.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.
